# UD Karelian KKPP

Language: [Karelian](/krl/index.html) (code: `krl`)<br/>
Family: Uralic, Finnic

This treebank has been part of Universal Dependencies since the UD v2.4 release.

The following people have contributed to making this treebank part of UD: Tommi A Pirinen.

Repository: [UD_Karelian-KKPP](https://github.com/UniversalDependencies/UD_Karelian-KKPP)<br />
Search this treebank on-line: [PML-TQ](https://lindat.mff.cuni.cz/services/pmltq/#!/treebank/udkrl_kkpp214)<br />
Download all treebanks: [UD 2.14](/#download)

License: CC BY-SA 4.0

Genre: nonfiction, news, web

Questions, comments?
General annotation questions (either Karelian-specific or cross-linguistic) can be raised in the [main UD issue tracker](https://github.com/UniversalDependencies/docs/issues).
You can report bugs in this treebank in the [treebank-specific issue tracker on Github](https://github.com/UniversalDependencies/UD_Karelian-KKPP/issues).
If you want to collaborate, please contact [tommi&nbsp;•&nbsp;antero&nbsp;•&nbsp;pirinen&nbsp;(æt)&nbsp;uni-hamburg&nbsp;•&nbsp;de].
Development of the treebank happens outside the UD repository.
If there are bugs, either the original data source or the conversion procedure must be fixed.
Do not submit pull requests against the UD repository.

| Annotation | Source |
|------------|--------|
| Lemmas | annotated manually |
| UPOS | annotated manually, natively in UD style |
| XPOS | not available |
| Features | annotated manually, natively in UD style |
| Relations | annotated manually, natively in UD style |

## Description

UD Karelian-KKPP is a manually annotated new corpus of Karelian made in
Universal dependencies annotation scheme. The data is collected from
[VepKar corpora](http://dictorpus.krc.karelia.ru/en/corpus/text) and consists of
mostly modern news texts but also some stories and educational texts.



UD Karelian-KKPP is a manually annotated new corpus of Karelian made in
Universal dependencies annotation scheme. The data is collected from
[VepKar corpora](http://dictorpus.krc.karelia.ru/en/corpus/text) and consists of
mostly modern news texts but also some stories and educational texts. We have
based many decisions in the dependency annotations on pre-existing
Finnish treebanks. The morphological annotations and grammar are based on the
refered books (Zaikov, Ahtia) and the [Karelian
dictionary](http://kaino.kotus.fi/cgi-bin/kks/karjala.cgi), with necessary
orthographical modernisations.

## Acknowledgments

Finnish treebank developers for a good reference treebank and also [SETS
dep search](http://bionlp-www.utu.fi/dep_search/) which has been very useful in
finding equivalent examples from Finnish treebanks.

## References

* Zaikov, Pekka. *Vienankarjalan kielioppi. Lisänä harjotukšie ta lukemisto*
(2013).
* Ahtia, Edvard Vilhelm. *Karjalan kielioppi.* Karjalan Kansalaisseura, (1938).
* [Karjalan kielen
verkkosanakirja](http://kaino.kotus.fi/cgi-bin/kks/kks_etusivu.cgi)

<h2>Tokenization and Word Segmentation</h2>


<ul>
<li>This corpus contains 228 sentences and 3094 tokens.</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus contains 619 tokens (20%) that are not followed by a space.</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus does not contain words with spaces.</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus contains 54 types of words that contain both letters and punctuation. Examples: -projektin, -aktijo, -aktijoh, -aktijon, -lapšienpruasiekkua, Art-teltan, Art-teltta, L’udmila, WWF:n, -aktijolla, -eepossašta, -hiälaulun, -kanšalaisjärještön, -kaupunkin, -leheššä, -luomiskilpailun, -merkillä, -pelin, -saitilla, -teatterissa, -teemalla, -tehnikašša, -šuaren, 190-vuotispäivällä, 215-vuotispäivällä, 60.wwf.ru/, Art-šat’or, Bol’šoi, Iro-muamo, KT:n, Kalevala-, Kalevala-eepossah, Kalevala-eepossan, Kalevala-šeikkailupelie, Koval’ovan, Ledn’ova, Moskova-Sitikeškukšešša, Sem’onovan, TV-tornilla, kilpailu-festivali, kippuran’okkaset, kirjallisuš-, kulttuuri-, laulu-, miehol’ah, olka-päitä, partn’orit, rahvahan-, tanšši-, vaihtuas’s’a</li>
</ul>

<h2>Morphology</h2>

<h3>Tags</h3>

<ul>
<li>This corpus uses 14 UPOS tags out of 17 possible: <a>ADJ</a>, <a>ADP</a>, <a>ADV</a>, <a>AUX</a>, <a>CCONJ</a>, <a>INTJ</a>, <a>NOUN</a>, <a>NUM</a>, <a>PRON</a>, <a>PROPN</a>, <a>PUNCT</a>, <a>SCONJ</a>, <a>VERB</a>, <a>X</a></li>
<li>This corpus does not use the following tags: DET, PART, SYM</li>
</ul>

<ul>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus contains 24 lemmas tagged as pronouns (PRON): hiän, hyö, iče, joka, jokahini, kaikki, ken, kennih, koko, kumpaine, mi, mie, mitänä, molompi, moni, muu, myö, ne, nämä, sie, toini, työ, tämä, še</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus contains 0 lemmas tagged as determiners (DET): </li>
</ul>

<ul>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus contains 4 lemmas tagged as auxiliaries (AUX): ei, olla, piteä, voija</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>Out of the above, 2 lemmas occurred sometimes as AUX and sometimes as VERB: olla, piteä</li>
</ul>

      <li>AUX-Part: ollun</li>
      <li>VERB: tuli, otettih, ošallistu, leväheltih, luati, lähettih, otti, pelattih, piti, piäsi</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin: tuli, otettih, ošallistu, leväheltih, luati, lähettih, otti, pelattih, piti, piäsi</li>
      <li>VERB-Part: järješšetty, kirjutettu, käyty, peitetty, pietty, šanottu, šuunnattu</li>
    </ul>
  </li>
</ul>

<ul>
  <li>Pres
    <ul>
      <li>AUX-Fin: on, ei, voit, olet, ollah, pitäy, en, voijah, Oletko, emmä</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin: pitäy, tahon, šammutetah, auttau, huaveilen, järješšetäh, kannatetah, kučutah, maltat, otetah</li>
    </ul>
  </li>
</ul>

<ul>
  <li><a>Voice</a></li>
</ul>

<ul>
  <li>Act
    <ul>
      <li>ADP: ommellun, vaipun</li>
      <li>ADV-Fin: valittihki</li>
      <li>AUX-Fin: on, oli, ei, voit, olet, ollah, oltih, pitäy, en, voijah</li>
      <li>CCONJ: eikä</li>
      <li>VERB: tuli, pitäy, ošallistu, leväheltih, luati, otettih, otti, piti, piäsi, tahon</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin: tuli, pitäy, ošallistu, leväheltih, luati, otettih, otti, piti, piäsi, tahon</li>
    </ul>
  </li>
</ul>

<ul>
  <li>Pass
    <ul>
      <li>ADP: keritty, nimetty, omissettu, tultuoh, vaivuttu</li>
      <li>VERB: järješšetty, lähettih, tiijettäis, šammutettih, šyötih, eletäh, erotetah, heitettih, huomata, hyrähettih</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin: lähettih, tiijettäis, šammutettih, šyötih, eletäh, erotetah, heitettih, huomata, hyrähettih, ilmotetah</li>
      <li>VERB-Part: järješšetty, kirjutettu, käyty, lašettu, peitetty, pietty, šanottu</li>
    </ul>
  </li>
</ul>

  </li>

      <li>VERB-Fin: tahon, huaveilen, kačoin, pelasima, piemmä, piäsin, ajattelen, hokšasin, huomasin, issuin</li>
    </ul>
  </li>
</ul>

    </ul>
  </li>

      <li>VERB-Fin: tuli, pitäy, ošallistu, leväheltih, luati, otettih, otti, piti, piäsi, šai</li>

<h2>Syntax</h2>

<h3>Auxiliary Verbs and Copula</h3>

<ul>
<li>This corpus uses 1 lemmas as copulas (<a>cop</a>). Examples: olla.</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus uses 4 lemmas as auxiliaries (<a>aux</a>). Examples: olla, ei, voija, piteä.</li>
<li>This corpus uses 1 lemmas as passive auxiliaries (<a>aux:pass</a>). Examples: olla.</li>
</ul>

<h3>Core Arguments, Oblique Arguments and Adjuncts</h3>

Here we consider only relations between verbs (parent) and nouns or pronouns (child).
<ul>
  <li><a>nsubj</a>
    <ul>
      <li>VERB--NOUN-Nom (1)</li>
      <li>VERB--PRON-Nom (1)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--NOUN-Nom (71)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--NOUN-Par (2)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--PRON (1)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--PRON-Ela (1)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--PRON-Nom (80)</li>
      <li>VERB-Inf--NOUN-Nom (3)</li>
      <li>VERB-Inf--PRON-Gen (2)</li>
      <li>VERB-Inf--PRON-Ins (1)</li>
      <li>VERB-Inf--PRON-Nom (6)</li>
      <li>VERB-Part--NOUN-Nom (2)</li>
    </ul>
  </li>
</ul>

<ul>
  <li><a>obj</a>
    <ul>
      <li>VERB--NOUN-Nom (1)</li>
      <li>VERB--NOUN-Par (2)</li>
      <li>VERB--PRON-Par (1)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--NOUN-Gen (16)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--NOUN-Gen-ADP(nimeltäh) (1)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--NOUN-Nom (33)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--NOUN-Par (77)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--PRON-Acc (2)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--PRON-Gen (2)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--PRON-Nom (3)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--PRON-Par (12)</li>
      <li>VERB-Inf--NOUN-Gen (2)</li>
      <li>VERB-Inf--NOUN-Nom (5)</li>
      <li>VERB-Inf--NOUN-Par (24)</li>
      <li>VERB-Inf--PRON-Ela (1)</li>
      <li>VERB-Inf--PRON-Gen (1)</li>
      <li>VERB-Inf--PRON-Nom (1)</li>
      <li>VERB-Inf--PRON-Par (7)</li>
      <li>VERB-Part--NOUN-Nom (4)</li>
      <li>VERB-Part--NOUN-Par (1)</li>
    </ul>
  </li>
</ul>

<ul>
  <li><a>iobj</a>
    <ul>
    </ul>
  </li>
</ul>



<h3>Verbs with Reflexive Core Objects</h3>

<ul>
  <li>This corpus contains 3 lemmas that occur at least once with a reflexive core object (<a>obj</a> or <a>iobj</a>). Examples: merkitä iččie, muu iččie, šuvaija iččie</li>
</ul>

<h3>Relations Overview</h3>

<ul>
<li>This corpus uses 9 relation subtypes: <a>acl:relcl</a>, <a>aux:pass</a>, <a>compound:prt</a>, <a>cop:own</a>, <a>flat:name</a>, <a>nmod:gsubj</a>, <a>nmod:poss</a>, <a>nsubj:cop</a>, <a>xcomp:ds</a></li>
<li>The following 8 relation types are not used in this corpus at all: <a>iobj</a>, <a>csubj</a>, <a>expl</a>, <a>dislocated</a>, <a>clf</a>, <a>list</a>, <a>reparandum</a>, <a>dep</a></li>
</ul>
